intro: Mesembryanthemum album, commonly known as the white mesembryanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are typically fleshy and adapted to store water, reflecting its succulent nature and ability to thrive in arid environments. Mesembryanthemum album is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
